policy: Accepts the International Council for Harmonisation (ICH) Common Technical Document (CTD) format for innovator pharmaceutical product registrations.
explanation: Indonesia does not accept the ICH CTD format for pharmaceutical registrations and instead uses the ASEAN Common Technical Dossier (ACTD) format.

policy: Provides a fully digital online submission portal for pharmaceutical product marketing authorization applications.
explanation: Indonesia provides a fully digital online submission portal for pharmaceutical product marketing authorization applications through its e-Registration system and the Online Single Submission platform.

policy: Legally requires acceptance of another ASEAN Member Stateâ€™s (AMS) Certificate of Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) for pharmaceutical manufacturers.
explanation: Indonesia is obligated to accept cGMP certificates from other ASEAN member states under the ASEAN MRA on GMP, but actual acceptance may vary based on national regulations and alignment of inspection standards.
